t: PFR - Late Great PFR - Amazon.com Music
s: It's 2015 and I just barely re-discovered PFR!!!! I'm actually sorry that I forgot about them for this long!! PFR was a big reason I took up guitar when I was a teen. I used to listen to this album on my CD walkman (that makes me feel so old but im only 30!) to go to sleep every night for a ...

t: Amazon.com: Very Best Of PFR : PFR: Digital Music
s: Originally called Inside Out, PFR was formed in Minnesota by Mark Nash, Joel Hanson, and Patrick Andrew. For their 1992 album debut on Sparrow, the trio changed their name to Pray for Rain but changed it again to PFR for sophomore work Goldie's Last Days. 1994 brought the release of Great Lengths; ...

PfR's last album before their breakup in 1996, Them, is certainly a great `finale' to the great band (even though they had a greatest hits album in 1997, The Late Great PfR, and then a brand new album in 2001, Disappear). The album's first song is "Pour Me Out", a great rocker to start off ...

Check out PFR on Amazon Music. Stream ad-free or purchase CD's and MP3s now on Amazon.

As a long time PFR fan I believe Great Lengths is a prime example of the incredible talent these guys possess. First, they show a wide variety of talent within the style of each song from one to the next throughout the album. From beautiful and prayerful melodies to head bangin rock!
